semantic_title: Physeal Fractures - Single Code Assignment Rule
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 19. Injury, Poisoning, and Certain Other Consequences of External Causes > c. Coding of Traumatic Fractures > 3) Physeal fractures

content.full_text: For physeal fractures, assign only the code identifying the type of physeal fracture. Do not assign a separate code to identify the specific bone that is fractured. (Evidence: pg no: 80, L66-L67)
content.summary: Coding rule for physeal fractures requiring only the physeal fracture type code without additional bone-specific codes (Evidence: pg no: 80, L66-L67)
key_concepts: Single code assignment for physeal fractures (Evidence: pg no: 80, L66-L67)
Exclusion of separate bone codes (Evidence: pg no: 80, L67)

detailed_rules.rule_text: For physeal fractures, assign only the code identifying the type of physeal fracture (Evidence: pg no: 80, L66-L67)
detailed_rules.explanation: Physeal fracture codes are comprehensive and include both the fracture type and bone information (Evidence: pg no: 80, L66-L67)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not assign a separate code to identify the specific bone that is fractured (Evidence: pg no: 80, L67)
detailed_rules.explanation: The physeal fracture code already incorporates the bone location, making additional bone codes redundant (Evidence: pg no: 80, L67)
